website_summaries.verdict: This set is the largest Spirograph set. It has a lot of pieces and some unusual shapes others do not include.
pros: Adults can enjoy as much as kids
Includes putty to hold the gears in place as you make patterns
cons: The 75 pieces advertised in this set includes the number of papers

customer_reviews.title: she was very happy to get one even 30 years
customer_reviews.text: Wife wanted one since she did not get one when she was younger.... she was very happy to get one even 30 years later
customer_reviews.author: Sam Fitting

customer_reviews.title: Not Just For Kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a Xmas gift for my 68-year old father who likes to draw/paint and is very analytical and mathematically inclined. This was perfect because it is all based on sine/cosine wave functions. So, kind of like the way one can read Huckleberry Finn either as a fun child's story in elementary school, or on a higher, more analytical level in college, so may this be used as a toy, or as an interesting diversion that even a grumpy old accountant can enjoy. (Just kidding, he's a nice guy!)
customer_reviews.author: Piscio e Aceto

customer_reviews.title: spirograph
customer_reviews.text: the super spirograph i gave it 3 stars number 1 the spiro-putty gets hard and do not stick anymore i went to the store and had to get LOCTITE fun-tak it works better. number 2 you think after all the spirographs that was made the numbers of the holes in the wheels should be in black so you can see the numbers and the lines better. number 3 the pens ink skips or to light they should be more dark. thank goodness and have a lot gel pens that is better and bic pens it does make a lot of great design and you will lose track of time.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jo Heath

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and get the die cast kit.
customer_reviews.text: Giant case is a PITA. These are not your childhood toys. The plastic is really flimsy and it was a lot harder to use than the old one. It was missing a piece of the track. It came with one metal disk that worked far better than the plastic ones. I wish I'd have just purchased the die cast one. The tracks are interesting, but really not worth it. The paper is straight garbage. It tears and gets soaked before you can finish the drawing. The polymer that you use to stick the rings down will tear the paper and really get stuck to the rings.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: What happened to the spirograph??!! I ...
customer_reviews.text: What happened to the spirograph??!! I bought it for my granddaughter who is 7. Her parents and of course the grandparents played with this when we were young. The four of us with a combined college education of 22 years plus had no idea how to do it. would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: cheri

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as I remembered it
customer_reviews.text: This was the set I had almost four decades ago, and I wanted my son to have the same experience I had. This package contains a lot of practice paper and three pens to get you started. The variety of pieces is fantastic, allowing for all kinds of designs to be made. A decent guide book is included. I had only one issue and that was the quality of the plastic. The pieces felt a bit cheap, but not incredibly so. The storage box is perfect for protecting the pieces, but don't give this to a child with a heavy hand. Patience helps, too. Because of the plastic quality, too much pressure will crack the gears.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Putty Tears the Paper - Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Many reviewers have written about the cheaply made parts and about the ineffective putty. I agree with all of those negative reviews. Potential buyers should also know that the putty easily tears the paper when removed. While some reviewers have implemented work arounds to secure the rings on the paper, I believe that one should be able to expect the Spirograph to work as designed. I suggest that you not waste your money. I will be returning this for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Melodie Ubuntu Gellman

customer_reviews.title: I Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: This makes me feel like a kid again. They give you putty instead of the little pins to hold the wheels in place, and it doesn't stick very well but eh. Times have changed, right? Some kid must have eaten a pin or stuck himself 30 years ago so now it's putty.. I will probably order the pins-I found them online. But no matter what... it's freakin SPIROGRAPH to the Nth!!!!! Every widget wheel and piece of track you could want all in one super fun box!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE it!!
customer_reviews.author: AstroGirl12

customer_reviews.title: A giant box for some awfully thin components
customer_reviews.text: The entire box of components fits in a zip-lock freezer bag I had sitting around with room to spare, despite the box being large enough to pass as a thin suitcase. A ton of wasted packaging that'll make you feel like it's less of a deal once it's sitting out on a table. The actual usability is solid however, but if you're letting smaller children play with this, it's best if it's done with supervision. It is fully possible the break the thin plastic parts without trying.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: A near
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been drawn to the symmetry of geometry for many years, and being able to make one’s own designs is too fun to turn down. This set is the most deluxe I’ve ever used. My one complaint is the putty that is used to mount parts to the paper is dried-out. Entirely useless. The original sets of the 60s used pins, and the main “gears” still have parameter holes, so nothing is stopping us adults from using pushpins. For kids, there are mounting putties that would work well. This is a wonderful gift for those who love to create unique & intricate designs. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Romaine Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: A big case, with lots of goodies!
customer_reviews.text: I remember using a spirograph as a kid, once. It was fun, but that trend didn't catch with my generation where I live. Therefore, I had to wait until recently to get my hands on one of these! I'm really happy with my purchase. Using the spirograph is relaxing and entertaining. It's just the kind of mindless fun that I like to empty my mind with and leave all stress behind. Even my cats enjoy watching the spirograph in use. They just sit down on the table next to me and follow the entire process as I draw.
customer_reviews.author: Thredith

customer_reviews.title: A Great Distraction
customer_reviews.text: I never had a Spirograph as a kid, although I REALLY wanted one! As a result, I finally bought one. I really enjoy using it. It is a relaxing distraction from all the turmoil in our world/society. You can create your own designs or use the instruction book included with the set. Either way, it's a lot of fun. My one complaint concerns the adhesive putty included with the kit. It is hard and very difficult to use. My suggestion is to purchase some reuseable craft putty (you can get it at an art supply store) and use it to adhere the plastic molds to your paper. Much easier than having to use the putty included with the Spirograph.
customer_reviews.author: JeffD

customer_reviews.title: A very good set for the price paid
customer_reviews.text: Had bought for my nieces to use and for a late birthday gift. It is a very nice set and comes with two pens and the gold anniversary disc in it. The one thing that I wish that Spirograph would do is get rid of that "putty" they include to hold down the items so the kids can make the designs with now. I really rather they go back to what I remember which is the pins that what as much better than the putty. Over all for the price I think it was a very good deal and I had bought the 60 gel pens and extra white paper so they could use it to their hearts content.
customer_reviews.author: Music & Book Fan

customer_reviews.title: A great creative set.
customer_reviews.text: This Spirograph Set was everything I ever wanted. I am an older man and always wanted a set as a child. I never had one. At Christmas my wife asked me what I wanted and I thought, "a Spirograph set". I can relax after work in my home office and create some designs just for fun. The packaging is great for storage and I appreciate the quality. It will take a lot of practice and mistakes to create the designs that are shown completed in the documentation and advertisements. It's all worth it. 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Cover the walls and fridge with the resulting engineering artwork of your personal, children's and grandkids experiments!
customer_reviews.text: Great STEM interactive technology, it's proven over the last 50 or so years to continue to entertain, engage users in proven scientific process skills, increasing an interest in engineering and gears... All the while letting the users also express themselves artistically. As a parent of 20-30 year olds with 7 grandkids including a 2.5 year old up to 8 years of age and my wife and I, 55 years old have been drawn into successfully "playing" and exploring with the multiple gearing ratios and torques. Beware... Every inch of postable fridge and wall space will be covered with beautiful artistic creations. Buy and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: CurtyC

customer_reviews.title: Older “kids” like it too
customer_reviews.text: I had the first Spirograph back in the 60s, so this super set brings back many happy childhood memories and gives hours of fun. It’s wonderful and relaxing. I had never used the tacky stuff to hold the rings before. The secret is that body heat softens it, so it sticks better and flattens, but too soft and it can stick to the paper, too. I bought an extra set of gel pens for more colors, but the pens that come with the set work great. Exceeded my expectations. Perfect for gifting, too.
customer_reviews.author: G. Allinson

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your $! Bought for my granddaughter for her birthday. The putty is useless, it was too hard to even use. Sure you can order some kind of Elmer’s Glue putty but it is advertised as not reusable. This was a huge disappointment for my granddaughter and I do not recommend anyone waste your money on it. It is not the old fashion board with teeth around the edges and “gears” you maneuver around the board with a pen or pencil. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Carol D.

customer_reviews.title: Throwback
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself for Christmas. It's a great artistic toy from my youth. The packaging and accessories are pretty great. I was disappointed with the little bit of sticky whatever to hold the rings down so, I bought push-pins instead. My guess is some kid ate the pins and the rest of the world has to accommodate.
customer_reviews.author: Popapotamus

customer_reviews.title: Great kit but not for under 10 or more realistically 11-12 year olds!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my granddaughter & I to do together but it was extremely complicated (I don’t remember them being that complicated as a 10 year old) but after reading the instructions I decided to send it back. First, I would have had to go through the instructions & relearn it myself & I still think she would have had a hard time. Personally, I think the age range should start at 11 or 12 years. I plan to buy again if she is still interested in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: NCB

customer_reviews.title: Watch a tutorial first!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I absolutely LOVE these Spirographs. We went on YouTube and found a tutorial that made all the difference in the world. The key to using this correctly is to watch the GEARS at all times, DON’T watch the pen or pencil or you will miscalculate and the gears will jump off.
customer_reviews.author: C Brady

customer_reviews.title: All good except—
customer_reviews.text: Re: Giftable and Easy to use—Extremely similar to the old original set. HOWEVER, the sticky stuff that now is supposed to hold the guide pieces in place was so old and hard that is was not workable and not sticky. If you purchase this as a gift for a child who tears into it right now, you better have some of that blue sticky tack for hanging posters on the wall or you are going to be holding the pieces in place while the child makes designs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toy from my childhood is fun
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my grandchildren to use when they come over. It does take some coordination & isn't always easy to use, but once you get the hang of it, it works very well. I wish it came with pins instead of the sticky stuff to hold the pieces down though. I'll be getting some push pins for this purpose. The gel pens work really well with the Spirograph too.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with Spirograph and this set drove me insane. The interlocking parts rarely connect. That and it's nearly impossible to draw anything once you establish a track because the paper and/or track moves around. If anything, this snap-together-kit should have a perimeter track. As an educated adult, at least I thought I was, I couldn't get this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Goodberg

customer_reviews.title: Nostogia time
customer_reviews.text: Took me back to my cjildhood 50 years ago loved my spirograph. Only has 3 colors of pens instead of the 4 the original had but you use any 1mm point pen i use one of the bic 4 color pins fine point works great uses puty instead of pins to hold the pievesvto tje paper i tjink pins worked betterbno reason cant still use pins using a piece of cardboard. But i love beingbreminded how much fun I had with my spirograph
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Quillen

customer_reviews.title: Taking me back to my childhood!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for me 8 year old daughter. I remember these from when I was a kid. She was totally confused.. like "what on earth is this?!" It's a good buy and she really enjoys it. I do wish it was a really easier to keep organized. There is a clear plastic that goes over the pieces, however it doesn't stay so when you sit it upright, everything falls out of it's designated place. Other than that, we like it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Teves

customer_reviews.title: Better quality than expected
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I always wanted this when I was a kid so when my 24 year old daughter said she wanted one at Christmas I couldnt wait to give it to her. She will get it for her birthday in January so it is killing me to wait. The package it os stored in is super nice and should store nicely as there are a lot of parts In this thing.
customer_reviews.author: teresauminn

customer_reviews.title: Spiro putty is dry and does not stick :-(
customer_reviews.text: My child was really looking forward to this as BD present. But the spiri putty is dry and hard as dried concrete. After trying to add water, it does not help. She is very frustrated not being able to make a design she wanted because the ring keeps moving without the putty. She tried to use double sided tape which does not work either.
customer_reviews.author: Zmx

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, case is nice but a little weak.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of great things inside this kit, multiple gears and tracks, paper, markers, directions all in an organized kit. The amount of things you get in the kit is great. The outside of the box itself is a heavy weight cardboard, the inside is plastic and this is the only part of this kit I take issue with. The plastic is a little wimpy and I am guessing with heavy use it will get dented out of shape, mushed and possibly broken. I wish they had made the interior of the case stronger to match the strength of the exterior and the product itself. My kids are enjoying playing and learning how to do spirograph drawings!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hamele

customer_reviews.title: Nice complete set
customer_reviews.text: Nice complete set, I modified it to take stick pins as the original did in the 60's. Used a drill to create tiny holes in pieces because the clay they include just doesn't do the job of holing the pieces steady. The manufacturer was worried about being sued by lawsuit happy Americans I'm sure, yes I'm American. Guess kids will eat the stickpins in this day and time but not in the 60's when personal responsibility was the norm......but I digress.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: Please sell more spirograph pens so we can have super beautiful work all the time.
customer_reviews.text: Im really enjoying this wonderful spirograph. The only drawback is that you cant purchase more pens like the original spirograph pens that come with the purchase. They are the very best. I intend to use up all the ink and buy more pens exactly like the ones that came with this set. Very disapointing. However, Paper Mate Flair med is a very good pen too and although I prefer the original spirograph pens, I would use the Paper Mate Flair M as replacements. Beautiful colors and sharp crisp lines.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Spencer

customer_reviews.title: My kids love this set - and because it's so big
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this set - and because it's so big, they can play it together. The one problem, which I still haven't fixed, is that some of the tiny posts don't fit into the tiny holes when assembling the curved pieces. Because of this, the track doesn't lay flat and the wheels jump off, messing things up. I need to contact the company about this. To make life easier, I used a fine sharpie and labeled each wheel so that it is easy to read the size and I labeled the packaging as to which wheel goes where.
customer_reviews.author: Anon745

customer_reviews.title: A great product that I'm glad is back in the marketplace again.
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome toy as a kid and I enjoy it just as much as an adult now that I can appreciate more about the mathematics behind it. Yes, the putty (now used to hold the rings in place instead of those plastic things that made holes in the paper) will need to be replaced. Yes, you'll probably want to pick up some more pens, too, while you're here. And yes, you'll still need "that certain touch" at times to prevent "teeth skipping" while drawing. I bought one for myself and another for my tween nephews and hope they'll enjoy this as much as their father and I did growing up in the late 70s.
customer_reviews.author: John Sterbenz

customer_reviews.title: Forty Something Nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: Our middle daughter is going through her second childhood. She doesn’t seem to remember a complete set, only parts thereof. We got it for her recent birthday. She immediately got it out to play with and began to explain the math behind how it works. Now that she has the anniversary edition with all the bells and whistles - and doesn’t have to share - she is in geek heaven
customer_reviews.author: Betty Boop

customer_reviews.title: Childhood all over again! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I thought of these out of the blue and it brought back my childhood playing with these in elementary and middle school. They are so much fun to play with and all the amazing features. Only negative is the pieces do come off the paper and the tack doesn't hold that well in mine. But if you go slow and smooth everything works great. The trick is to find the perfect pens. That's been my challenge lately. Love it
customer_reviews.author: KBAD

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit.  A bit advanced for a 9 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set. Has a lot of items in it. Is well contained. Easily stored and transported in the case it comes in. My 9 year old niece really liked it but it was just a bit advanced for her to use and figure out. I had to help her make some of the basic designs and it was a bit hard for her to keep the wheels in place on her own so she could make the designs but i think with some help and practice she will grow into using it.
customer_reviews.author: mamaof2boys

customer_reviews.title: like new !
customer_reviews.text: I bought one which was said used. It came with original package, no damage at all! Besides, spirograph is so much fun! It was my favorite during childhood. Definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Y_ui

customer_reviews.title: Best Spirograph Set ever!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! My son is not "phased" by much (mature almost 7 year old) but he LOVES this set! Definitely worth the few extra $$. Can snap pieces together in many shapes for "outer tracks", comes with paper, carry case, AND I really like that the holes in each disc are numbered so if the pen slips out you know where to put it back in. Bought some extra pens on Amazon as well for more color ful projects
customer_reviews.author: Sharon B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing gift! Be very careful when opening it though as it is closed with strong Velcro. Not magnetism. Trying to open it one side of the paper ripped because the Velcro would not release. But granddaughter was super excited when she seen it. And she loved the metal gold piece!
customer_reviews.author: C. Reffruschinni

customer_reviews.title: We love it and are glad we bought this one.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly how I remember it in the 90's. My daughter loves it but it is challenging and takes some getting used to. She loves practicing and getting better at it. She's 7. I love that it comes with pens and sticky tack to hold down the frames. There's still holes so you can use pins like back in the day but we don't like the holes in our paper. You can also built your own frames and do a border around the paper or get really creative. It comes with paper too and a nice little carrying case. Shipping was fast and on time. Product was as described.
customer_reviews.author: Shayla

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 8 year old son for Christmas. The set has lots of interesting shapes to let your imagination "spiral". While it was a toy for my 8 year old during the course of the Christmas every adult in the house tried making designs along with the 10 and 6 year olds staying with us. It was fun to have so many ages drawn into the fun, sitting around the table creating. On a side note I purchsed a large pack of Ink Joy colored gel pens to use with the set. Having the extra colors makes the designs better then just the red, black and blue pens that come with the set.
customer_reviews.author: Robin S.

customer_reviews.title: Many years since used a Spirograph and still love them
customer_reviews.text: Bought for granddaughter for Christmas. It has been years since I had used a Spirograph, so had to play with it to get the hang of it again. Once we got the right amount of putty to hold the pieces in place, it worked great! If you use too much of the putty it raises the spiral pieces too high and the smaller spiral being used in the center to make designs tends to go under the larger spiral. As a result you have a sloppy uneven design.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Williams

customer_reviews.title: A little more cheaply made, but with some nice improvements anyway.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't played with a Spirograph for almost 4 decades, so I was interested to see the changes made to the kits produced today. They use bigger pen holes, so you have a larger variety of pens that fit and work. They have more designs available with the tracks you can build. They are thinner gears, and they feel cheaper and more flimsy than the 70's kits, which I think may be part of making them so more non-Spirograph Kit pens work with the gears and rings. The new putty that replaces the old push-pins is superior.
customer_reviews.author: BrianP

customer_reviews.title: Junk. No comparison to original.
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made. Tracks are paper thin, wobbly and do not fit together well. They no longer have a flange that keeps the gear from riding up. Way over priced for what it is. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Guy

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas Gift ever
customer_reviews.text: My oldest daughter asked for ONE thing this year for Christmas. She was so happy when she opened up this gift to see what it was. She has been using it almost non stop for the last few months. It was in wonderful condition and came quickly. I would buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Miller

customer_reviews.title: I can't begin to describe the fun we have had with this Spirograph
customer_reviews.text: I can't begin to describe the fun we have had with this Spirograph. I had one of these as a child and this version is like comparing a Mercedes to a Volkswagon. There is nothing it won't do. We have been making patterns and then coloring them. My six year old granddaughter has to have help setting it up but it's a great activity to do together so that is no problem. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was bought for a classroom of children with special needs but they enjoyed it
customer_reviews.text: It was bought for a classroom of children with special needs and they all loved it and they were all able to do it the pens were destroyed but they enjoyed it we just have to buy more pens which is pricey
customer_reviews.author: jean

customer_reviews.title: Just like I remember, but better!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received it right away. I'm having so much fun with this, it reminds me of my childhood! My teenagers are discovering Spirograph for the first time and they love it! This is the perfect thing to get them off of their phones and away from Netflix and the video games!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K. McKee

customer_reviews.title: Fun Spirograph kit for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: Fun Spirograph kit for the whole family. This classic toy helps get children away from the TV, computer, and their phones. Comes with very nice ink pens but other pens at home will work as well. There's plenty of pieces in this box for 4 or 5 children to play with at a time. It's almost overwhelming how many different designs you can make with this kit. Inexpensive and fun for years to come. FYI all contents in this kit will fit easily into a gallon sized plastic zip lock baggie. Easier storage.
customer_reviews.author: James Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Woohoo! How fun does it get?
customer_reviews.text: Arrived well packaged, on time, in perfect condition! Awesome case made to store everything. As a kid, I only received the basic Spirograph. This Super Spirograph is top shelf, so much more than the basic one. Has detailed instructions, a pad of paper, pens, everything at your fingertips! I LOVE this retro toy! You're NEVER too old to have fun...I'm 60 and I purchased this as a gift to myself...yes indeed!
customer_reviews.author: Honeyplh

customer_reviews.title: Works really well and fun to introduce our kids to toys that my wife ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well and fun to introduce our kids to toys that my wife and I played with as a kid. I will say that the plastic templates slide on the paper and they do not give you a lot of the putty to hold them down. We just started taping ours down or holding onto them really tightly. It works, but it is very frustrating when you have an awesome design and the stencil slips which make it look bad. Still lots of fun though!!
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Better than I remembered. . . . .
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed similar things when I was very young, but using this now for serious art is just incredible! Easy to use, very sturdy......and allows for nearly unlimited creativity. Thoroughly enjoyable!
customer_reviews.author: Theodore T.

customer_reviews.title: ... sets as a child in 1967 or 68 and enjoyed it tremendously
customer_reviews.text: I received one of the original Spirograph sets as a child in 1967 or 68 and enjoyed it tremendously. Fifty years later, I find that I have a use for drawing the decorative flourish that goes around a framed certificate or photograph, so I bought one and am having as much fun now as I did then.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cocker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing set!
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge set. Making sure you have some quality pens goes a long way w success in this kit. The putty use to hold the base shape down is pretty worthless. I remember the original kits coming w push pins to securely lock the base shapes into place. Very fun for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Blake C Florin

customer_reviews.title: The design guide manual is in Spanish and Portuguese not English
customer_reviews.text: The design guide is not in English, the box says it's in English but it's in Spanish and Portuguese. You can figure out how to make the different designs but it annoying. The tracks are easy to put together but seem fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: great toy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our 8 yr. old granddaughter and her 10 yr. old brother and 13 yr. old sister couldn't pull themselves away from it. She didn't seem as interested in it. I think she is a bit young for it but it will be a great family toy. They were quiet for about an hour so their mother loved it! It can be very simple or very complicated. A real challenge yet the 8 yr old can have fun with it too.
customer_reviews.author: Thresa

customer_reviews.title: Makes cool designs
customer_reviews.text: Fun and make really cool designs but not sure why the fun tack doesn't hold the plastic rings in place like they used to. It'seems a little challenging for the kids to hold the plastic peice in place while circling. Lots of peices and we get by but i just remember it being more stable when I was young. Also, this one has a lot of prices and I don't think we have even used them all, so smaller version would've been just as much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Tigershops

customer_reviews.title: Throw back to my childhood!
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old son saw this product advertised on television and had to have it. I never would have guessed it! But I remember having one as a kid and loving it!! Way back when... Well - I couldn't find it anywhere in the DFW area - so Amazon came to the rescue. Loved this particular one because it has all the extras. Hours and hours and hours of entertainment. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BrownySquare

customer_reviews.title: Nastalgic!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it but the ease of use isn't up to par. The putty it comes with that hold the rings down gets stuck in the holes and makes it harder to get it flat on the paper.
customer_reviews.author: TaT2pjr

customer_reviews.title: 50th Anniversary Spirograph
customer_reviews.text: Needs to come with a mat (old school had cardboard) and the push pins to hold the piece in place. Haven't tried it yet, but am skeptical about that piece. Nothing has ever worked as well as the original because of that, but I lOvE the product...so we will see how much art we can produce...
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Maas

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. The wheels and pieces do not stay in place as show in the pictures. As soon as you close the "box" the pieces go everywhere. The putty that is supposed to hold the wheel to the paper does not allow the wheel to sit flush with the paper and the pieces slide underneath it when trying to make a design. Also, the pieces that are supposed to snap together do not snap well and are therefore useless. Very disappointed with this particular product.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie M.

customer_reviews.title: Either my memory is slipping or these are just not ...
customer_reviews.text: Either my memory is slipping or these are just not made as well as they used to be. Rings kept cracking and chipping with the slightest fall from the kitchen table. We finally just gave up on them. I definitely wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Great for any activity
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my friend she's been wanting one for a long time and when she saw it she was completely surprised by it and was delighted and shocked buy the things inside I would recommend this to anyone who would love something like this
customer_reviews.author: Shawn L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Childhood classic creativity.
customer_reviews.text: Childhood classic creative kit. Way more than I remember when I was a kid, but had so much fun with these I ordered one for my nieces. Such a great toy.
customer_reviews.author: sdnelson11

customer_reviews.title: Delightful fun
customer_reviews.text: at seventy, always wanted one, and I am having fun playing with it. Great designs. Endless entertainment. Makes me feel more artistic than I really am.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas N. Burson

customer_reviews.title: Best Arts and Craft Toy Ever
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn’t like to twirl and swirl on a Spirograph? Great for today’s kids who missed out on a super easy way to make complicated looking drawings. And adults, forget the coloring books, this is much more meditative.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter love this Jumbo Kit. She will spend hours working with picture after picture. It strikes up a sense of pride and accomplishment in the faces of a child when they stand back and look in awe at what they have created. There are plenty of shapes to please everyone and keep them busy for a long time. Remember to buy LOTS of paper and color pens! Now I am going to have to buy the standard set to accompany this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly George

customer_reviews.title: Super Spirograph made me feel like a kid again
customer_reviews.text: Super Spirograph made me feel like a kid again. Extended 75- piece Jumbo Kit provides a set which makes me feel like I am a kid again with this 50th Edition. Provided paper and pens. Arrived on time for me to get to creating art with this edition of Spirograph.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Glover

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere close to the original!
customer_reviews.text: While this set offers a lot of variety and endless potential for creativity, it fails to live up to the Spirographs of yesteryear. The "putty" included in the set to hold the pieces down is a horrible replacement for the pins that were once included. Also, connecting the different track pieces proves difficult and they often fall apart while the kids are trying to create.
customer_reviews.author: momof2plustwins

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgic toy
customer_reviews.text: I loved this toy as a kid and now my kids love it too! Fun to make the designs and the carrying case is great for storage. It does take a little to learn how much or how little putty is needed to make the one part stay in place so you can make the design. The pens work well although there is only three colors. It would be nice to have a larger selection of colors with the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Midsummer Night

customer_reviews.title: Old school awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is the end all be all of spirographs. I loved it as a kid and my kids love it now. It takes a little setup and cleanup but it’s so cool when you get going.
customer_reviews.author: Will F

customer_reviews.title: Yes, children, you can draw without a computer.
customer_reviews.text: Everything fits nicely in the case (mid-grade cardboard outside, plastic inside, Velcro closure). More shapes than my late 1970's model! Hope the kids will share. New, so don't know how long things will last.
customer_reviews.author: AuntieK8

customer_reviews.title: Extremely complex and difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very complex and extremely difficult to use,I should’ve stuck with the ordiginal one so I gave it away.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Blakely

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pieces, low in quality
customer_reviews.text: Lots of pieces, but the quality of the pieces is much lower than I expected. Everything functions, but the results are best viewed from a distance. Delivery was quick.
customer_reviews.author: reasonable1

customer_reviews.title: NOT LIKE THE STYLE OF YEARS AGO
customer_reviews.text: NOT LIKE YEARS AGO....POOR DESIGN. MY SON WAS VERY DISAPPOINTED ON HIS BIRTHDAY :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazonnnnn Customerrrrrrrr

customer_reviews.title: Just like you remember.
customer_reviews.text: Just like you remember! My 8 y.o. loves it. I wish the box held the pieces a little better since it is hard to fold both sides together to put it away without one or two pieces falling out of their spots, but this is easily solved by storing it in a small pencil box or the like. Great quality, the pieces are sturdy and the teeth mesh together perfectly ( which is important because there's nothing worse than being almost done with your masterpiece only to have the gears misalign on the last little bit and ruin your drawing.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's fifth birthday and should have returned it. The plastic pieces that make up the track are brittle and don't fit together well enough to be used. I find this very poor quality as it is obvious from Lego that plastic quality and functionality don't have to be a problem. I have used other brands that I was happier with (The Artist in Me), but strangely are no longer made.
customer_reviews.author: Apitch

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed mom and kiddo
customer_reviews.text: Two stars given for the variety of the designs you can make, but we didn't even get to that stage. I didn't realize that you had to make your own outline for the spirograph and feel that the pieces do not connect easily or well enough to keep it together. Also, it is difficult to keep the outline steady while also running the inside piece. Feel like I need two extra hands, so my 7 year old son doesn't even want to get it back out.... Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MEG HERING

customer_reviews.title: Broken but still loves the product
customer_reviews.text: When my sister opened her gift this morning one of the plastic pieces were broken so it was unable to connect to the other pieces. She loves it so it hasn’t stopped her from playing it.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Sagarminaga

customer_reviews.title: Torn box
customer_reviews.text: Just opened my package I received today. I was excited to open it but when I did I was disappointed to see that the handle was torn up, therefore making it unable to carry. So bummed! Going to return and hopefully the next one will be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Get some pens with it the three that come with it or not sufficient.
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift which hasn't been given yet send it since it is not yet Christmas. I can let you know later
customer_reviews.author: Busymomma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent art set, good quality.  Casing likely will need to be replaced within a year.
customer_reviews.text: Contents get a 5, but the covers over those parts get a 4. It is only a matter of time until the little plastic covers are lost or torn. Once they are gone, the parts will not stay in the case. May want to consider getting a nice little art box to go with this. Not much putty included with set, may wish to consider getting more at same times as when you purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Clapp

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Why they didn't have this set when I was a kid, I'll never know! Will be using this for future cards, decorations, etc. Would like to find additional pens for the set that will be as good as what comes with the package. Very cool!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... thought I'd try these as envelope designs and its perfect! I love them and its taking me for ...
customer_reviews.text: I make handcrafted greeting cards and thought I'd try these as envelope designs and its perfect! I love them and its taking me for a trip back to my childhood. Any kid would love to get these, even adults! Ive had friends come over and want to try them!
customer_reviews.author: Dori

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun inside.
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a Spirograph as a kid. I'm now over 50 years old but still young enough at heart to thoroughly enjoy this. I bought it for my wife and I to share and enjoy. It provides hours of relaxing enjoyment when we find the time to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fun using it!
customer_reviews.text: I have to get used to using one again. But I love the many things I can draw with this kut!
customer_reviews.author: Norma Baird

customer_reviews.title: These never go out of style!
customer_reviews.text: There is something nostalgic and wonderful about these things. I loved them as a kid forty years ago and now my kids have been wanting one too. Love the creativity they encourage.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: This was a great buy
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my nephew as a gift. I had a set of these when I was a kid and he loved it just as much. Kids are hard on toys but this set is in an amazing hard case for safe keeping and has lots of different designs to keep kids busy for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Family Fun
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn't like a gift that you can relate to when you were a child. Pure genius!
customer_reviews.author: Lind Lindstrand

customer_reviews.title: Interlocking parts... don't
customer_reviews.text: I bought this version because I thought the interlocking parts idea was pretty cool. Sadly, the idea and the execution are miles apart - most of the interlocking parts won't, well, interlock. Better to buy the non-interlocking version, which, since the parts don't interlock, presumably works better.
customer_reviews.author: peg2

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FUN
customer_reviews.text: I HAD A SET OF THESE WHEN I TAUGHT ART IN SCHOOL. THE CHILDREN TRIED A VARIETY OF DESIGNS AND COLORS
customer_reviews.author: L H. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Fun Set!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing set! Loads of fun for adults and children! Quality materials; pleasantly surprised for price not sure what to expect; exceeded all expectations. This is a set that will be with me for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Classic Fun. No Batteries Required
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Christmas and she LOVES it. She sat at the kitchen table for a long time and made some beautiful designs. No batteries or recharging required :) The vinyl case is nice. You might want to research what kinds of pens to buy to use with the set, because it was designed for old style ball point pens - the kind with a long, narrow point that fit through the small holes in the Spirograph sprocket wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good, clean, retro fun.
customer_reviews.text: I remember mom getting me one of these when I was young and I'd spend hours.... As an adult, I've just ordered one for myself to make backgrounds for my art journal and it's everything what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: barrymanglow

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to use and never works like you want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy that still delivers
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for my 9 year old daughter. She loves creating different designs and it’s nostalgic for me since I had one as a kid!
customer_reviews.author: LParnell

customer_reviews.title: Not the Same as the Old Spirographs...
customer_reviews.text: The old kit from my youth included pins to hold the spiral down, keeping it in place. Now they give you poster putty type stuff to use for that. It just doesn't work the best. As far as the kit itself...it's fabulous. Lots of spirals to make hundreds of different & unique designs.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri G

customer_reviews.title: Fun art set!
customer_reviews.text: 12 year old granddaughter loves this! I purchased extra Paper Mate pens in assorted colors to allow her more variety in her drawings. We all enjoyed taking our turn at making new designs and entering them in our own little contest.
customer_reviews.author: nana25

customer_reviews.title: Major Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to use this but it is terrible. Most of the pieces don't even fit together and when they did the connecting pieces broke when I tried to take them apart again. It is incredibly frustrating and brittle. Terrible experience and product.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Walters

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the entire family
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my wife - but next thing you know the kids started taking it over. It's fun for the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Chaplin

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Great package or box to store it in. Very nicely done. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

product_meta.title: Super Spirograph 75-piece Jumbo Kit (50th Anniversary Edition)
product_meta.description: Kahootz-Spirograph super kit. The classic interchangeable spiro- tracks let you create your own unique pattern shapes, taking your designs to a whole new and super level! this 13x18x1-1/2 inch package contains two racks, three design pens, six spiro-track end caps, one spiro-track tri-hub, four shaped wheels, eighteen wheels in different sizes, sixteen curved spiro-tracks in different sizes, two rings, spiro-putty, eight straight spiro-tracks, one twenty- four page design guide and jumbo paper and two twenty-five page design pads. Recommended for ages 8 and up. Conforms to ASTM d 4236. Imported.
feature_bullets: TWICE AS MANY GEARS as the original Spirograph! You'll have super fun with the Super Spirograph Kit that comes with unique arcs that snap together to form a variety of curves, to make even more spiro-tastic designs
50TH ANNIVERSARY! A gold-colored metal 50th anniversary commemorative Spirograph gear is included in the kit

SET INCLUDES - 31 Precision Spiro-Tracks, 21 Spirograph Precision Wheels, 2 Spirograph Precision Rings, 2 Spirograph Precision Racks, 31 oz(9g) Reusable SpiroPutty, 3 Design Pens, 12 Sheets of Jumbo Design Paper, 2 25-Page Design Pads, 24-Page Design Guide Book, 1 Carry-Along Storage Case with Built-In Work Surface, 1 Special Edition 50th Anniversary Die-Cast Spirograph Wheel
INSPIRED BY THE ORIGINAL 1965 SPIROGRAPH! Brought to you by Kahootz Toys, where we use our all our creative skills and passions to bring exciting, engaging kids' products into a world of play

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,792 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
